blockchain.name: Another Please
blockchain.desc:
A smart contract system is selling DownUnderLand tickets! Can you get them all?
Goal: Own all 30 tickets to DownUnderLand in your player wallet.

blockchain.name: Eight Five Four Five
blockchain.desc:
beginner
Warming up, let's get you setup and make sure you can connect to the blockchain infra ok :). Your challenge is to ensure the isSolved() function returns true!

blockchain.name: Immutable
blockchain.desc:
Can you make a contract that can become big and strong?
Goal: Become owner of this contract

blockchain.name: Monkeing Around
blockchain.desc:
I let some monkes take control of my smart contract development and they have messed everything up! Can you take back ownership of the contract?
Goal: Become owner of the MonkeingAround contract

crypto.name: apbq rsa i
crypto.desc: Just a simple RSA problem with some extra equations.

crypto.name: apbq rsa ii
crypto.desc: Just another simple RSA problem with some more extra equations.

crypto.name: dilithium
crypto.desc: Just a regular Dilithium implementation with some patches.

crypto.name: encrypted mail
crypto.desc: Zero-knowledge authentication, end-to-end encryption, this new mail app has it all. For a limited time, admins may be sending flags to users. Sign up today to get yours!

crypto.name: flag art
crypto.desc: I encoded the flag in a painting. Enjoy!

crypto.name: fnv
crypto.desc: I know FNV is not a cryptographic hash function, but it's secure since nobody wrote a tool to break it.

crypto.name: handshake
crypto.desc: A handshake is a common greeting in many places around the world.

crypto.name: hhhhh
crypto.desc: h hhhhh hhhh hhh hh hhhhh hh hh hhh hhhh hhhh hhh-hhhhh hhhhhhhhhh. hhhh hh hhh hhhhh?

crypto.name: lcg card gimmicks
crypto.desc: Can you perform card tricks like a true magician?

crypto.name: randomly chosen
crypto.desc: Can you recover the flag from this random jumble of characters?

misc.name: My First C Program
misc.desc:
I decided to finally sit down and learn C, and I don't know what all the fuss is about this language it writes like a dream!
Here is my first challenge in C! Its really easy after you install the C installer installer, after that you just run it and you're free to fly away with the flag like a berd!

misc.name: Needle In IAM
misc.desc:
I've been told the flag I need is in description of this role, but I keep getting an error with the following command. Surely there's another way?
gcloud iam roles describe ComputeOperator --project=<PROJECT>

misc.name: Smart Calculator
misc.desc: Check out this super smart calculator that I've built! Instead of having to calculate the solution for an equation everytime, why don't we just save the answer and never compute that equation again? P.S. This calculator can even parse octal numbers!

misc.name: Welcome to DUCTF
misc.desc:
To compile our code down here, we have to write it in the traditional Australian Syntax: ( Try reading bottom up! )
¡ƃɐlɟ ǝɥʇ ʇno noʎ ʇuᴉɹd ll,ʇᴉ puɐ ɹǝʇǝɹdɹǝʇuᴉ ǝɥʇ ɥƃnoɹɥʇ ʇᴉ unɹ puɐ ǝɹǝɥ ǝpoɔ sᴉɥʇ ǝʞɐʇ ʇsnJ .ƎWWIפ uɐɔ noʎ NOʞƆƎɹ I puɐ ┴∩Oq∀ʞ˥∀M ƃuᴉoפ '¡H∀N H∀Ǝ⅄ 'ɐʞʞɐ⅄ pɹɐH 'ǝʞᴉl sǝɹnʇɐǝɟ ɔᴉʇsɐʇuɐɟ ƃuᴉɹnʇɐǝℲ
.snlԀ snlԀ ǝᴉssn∀ ǝʌᴉsnlɔuᴉ ʎʇᴉuɐɟoɹd ǝɹoɯ 'ɹǝʇsɐɟ 'ɹǝʇʇǝq ǝɥʇ oʇ noʎ ǝɔnpoɹʇuᴉ I uɐɔ ʇnq ++Ɔ ɟo pɹɐǝɥ ǝʌ,no⅄

misc.name: baby ruby
misc.desc:
How well do you know your Ruby?
The flag is at /chal/flag.

misc.name: blinkybill
misc.desc:
Hey hey it's Blinky Bill!
NOTE: Flag is case-insensitive and requires placing inside DUCTF{} wrapper!

misc.name: daas
misc.desc: decompyle3 translates Python bytecode back into equivalent Python source code. Please enjoy this free service.

misc.name: impossible
misc.desc:
Lol I thought it would be funny to commit a CTF iceberg taboo and make an unsolvable CTF challenge, then gaslight competitors in support tickets.
There is no solution. I don't even know why I published files for this challenge anyway.

misc.name: mini dns server
misc.desc: This mini DNS server hands out free flags to fellow mini DNS enthusiasts.

misc.name: real baby ruby
misc.desc:
How well do you really know your Ruby?
The flag is at /chal/flag.

pwn.name: binary mail
pwn.desc: Welcome to binary mail v0.1.0. As we are still in beta, please consider all bugs as features for the time being.

pwn.name: downunderflow
pwn.desc: It's important to see things from different perspectives.

pwn.name: one byte
pwn.desc: Here's a one byte buffer overflow!

pwn.name: roppenheimer
pwn.desc: Can you discover the secret to nuclear fission?

pwn.name: safe calculator
pwn.desc: A world's first provably safe calculator!

pwn.name: shifty mem
pwn.desc:
Shifting as a SUID binary service, because why not?
Note: This challenge runs over TLS on port 443. You can connect with openssl (openssl s_client -quiet -connect <hostname>:443) or pwntools (remote('<hostname>', 443, ssl=True)). This shouldn't affect exploitation.

pwn.name: the great escape
pwn.desc:
Do you have an escape plan?
Flag: /chal/flag.txt

rev.name: All Fathers Wisdom
rev.desc:
We found this binary in the backroom, its been marked as "The All Fathers Wisdom" - See hex for further details. Not sure if its just old and hex should be text, or they mean the literal hex.
Anyway can you get this 'wisdom' out of the binary for us?

rev.name: SPACEGAME
rev.desc: ALL YOUR BASE ARE BELONG TO US. YOU ARE ON THE WAY TO DESTRUCTION.

rev.name: advanced vector expositions
rev.desc: Let's read (and write) a book about AVX.

rev.name: masked squares flag checker
rev.desc: This program checks the flag based on some simple arithmetic operations.

rev.name: number theoretic flag checker
rev.desc: This program checks the flag based on some operations involving numbers.

rev.name: pyny
rev.desc: I've never seen a Python program like this before.

rev.name: sideways
rev.desc: Animals such as crabs sometimes find it easier to move sideways.

rev.name: wrong signal
rev.desc: I am getting all the wrong signals from this binary.

web.name: 0day blog
web.desc:
hard bot
I decided to move my security blog for vulnerability disclosures to Drupal. It has a lot of cool features like caching for when it gets a lot of traffic...
But it will never be popular so oh well why am I even doing this?
Can you get the flag from /flag?

web.name: actually proxed
web.desc: Still cool haxxorz only!!! Except this time I added in a reverse proxy for extra security. Nginx and the standard library proxy are waaaayyy too slow (amateurs). So I wrote my own :D

web.name: cgi fridays
web.desc: 1999 called, and they want their challenge back.

web.name: crossed monkes
web.desc:
hard bot
Ghostccamm gave 24 monkes 4,200 cans of energy drinks and locked them in a basement to develop a secure file sharing platform.
After 3 days with no sleep, the monkes built this website. However, they are very cross for some reason.
Important! When exploiting the challenge instance, use your instance hostname not http://monkestorage:3000!

web.name: grades grades grades
web.desc: Sign up and see those grades :D! How well did you do this year's subject? Author: donfran

web.name: secure blog
web.desc:
Jeff hates frontend web development, but made a sick REST API using Django for his new secure blog.
Can you hack into the admin portal and grab the flag?

web.name: smooth jazz
web.desc: Sit back, relax, and enjoy this mini SQL injection challenge with some smooth jazz.

web.name: static file server
web.desc: Here's a simple Python app that lets you view some files on the server.

web.name: strapi in
web.desc:
Strapi in for a wild ride
You can log into my own Strapi server with the following credentials.
username: author@strapi.in
password: Sup3r secure auth0r pass?
Can you get the flag from /flag.txt?


# Login Details

- **username**: `author`
- **password**: `Sup3r secure auth0r pass?`

web.name: xxd server
web.desc: I wrote a little app that allows you to hex dump files over the internet.
